data.title: [UI] Chinese characters failing to render

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
We don't have great localization right now, though it would be good if we can render Chinese. 

I have done some tests with fonts that contain Chinese characters by replacing Vera in https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/tree/master/Resources/PlayerData/DefaultUI/fonts and it seemed to work.

It would be best if someone with their system language set to Chinese worked on this issue to ensure it is solved properly.

See this thread: https://discourse.atomicgameengine.com/t/pathname-dont-support-chinese/82

data.title: [WebView] Support deployment on Windows, macOS, and Linux

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body: The embedded Chromium WebView needs to be able to be deployed with an Atomic application on desktop.  Once this issue is out of staging we can fill this in more, in the meantime I'll give it a difficulty of 4, quite a bit involved.

data.title: [Installer] Add option for installing API documentation locally

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
We have API references for JavaScript/TypeScript, C#, and C++.  They are currently linked to online versions from the editor's help menu.  (I recently made this change while adding C#/C++ docs to save some download size and make installer faster as quite a few files).

There should be an offline doc option, which will:

1)  Modify the installer with options for including various API documentation JS/TS, C#, C++ locally, adding a note that if the option isn't checked, the docs are still available online

2)  Modify the url in the menu help section to use local or online based on availability

On macOS the app bundle will come with local API docs as we don't have an installer there... and on Linux ```--with-docs``` can be used when building the editor for local docs, until ThunderBeast gets a binary release going there.

data.title: [WebGL] Fix WebGL build on master
data.body:
We have PR coverage on Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, and iOS, however WebGL currently does not, it appears I broke the build!

Here's at least the first error when compiling under Emscripten

```
/Users/jenkins/Home/workspace/Atomic_EditorWebPlayer/Source/Atomic/Metrics/Metrics.cpp:97:9: error: use of undeclared identifier 'snprintf'; did you mean 'vswprintf'?
        snprintf(name, NAME_MAX_LENGTH, "%-20s", metric.classname.CString());
```

There may be more errors, or this may be the only one, who will find out? 🎱

data.title: [Editor] - Update welcome screen (again) with new support forum

data.title: [Editor] Explore using Blender as scene editor for AtomicEditor
data.body: This would be sooo cool, it has me giddy just thinking about it.  At the very least, we should support people using Blender as a standalone editor, and not require it.

data.title: Added all keys and scancodes that are supported by SDL but not mapped
data.body:
You'll notice the `KEY_UNKNOWN` on line 269 is not in atomic begin/end blocks.  This is because [Urho actually has this mapped](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Source/Urho3D/Input/InputEvents.h#L258) in the latest version, so I didn't see a reason to add it in the blocks.

I will at some point make a PR adding these to Urho itself, and if/when they merge we can replace ours from upstream.

Fixes #1337.

data.title: [C#] Setting a new parent on a node causes the components on that node to no longer be updated
data.body:
In the reproduction case added by branch https://github.com/LumaDigital/AtomicTests/tree/MB_AddParentNoUpdate playing the project will show an initially animating chest, which stops rotating after 10 frames. This happens when the chest's node is parented to a different node. 

The following is output to AtomicPlayer.log:
```
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Child Update

[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Child Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Child Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Child Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Child Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Child Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Child Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Child Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Child Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:14:59 2017] DEBUG: Reparent
[Tue Jan 10 15:15:04 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:15:04 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:15:04 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:15:04 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
[Tue Jan 10 15:15:04 2017] DEBUG: Parent Update
```
Note the alternating Child and Parent updates, until the reparent, after which only the parent update happens.

data.title: [Editor] Cut / Copy / Paste not working in OSX Sierra in dev build
data.body:
It appears something changed since #697 was fixed.  For some reason the editor no longer handles the keyboard shortcuts for cut copy and paste.  This appears to work correctly in the latest binary download (as of 2017-01-09), but when building the dev build, it doesn't work.  

I'm Running OSX Sierra.

data.title: [Build] Move node binaries and node_modules to ThirdPartyBinaries submodule

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
We currently have node binaries in:

Windows:
https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/tree/master/Build/Windows/node

macOS:
https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/tree/master/Build/Mac/node

Linux's node is a script: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Build/Linux/node/node

We also have node_modules in:

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/tree/master/Build/node_modules

These will be moved to a submodule so will be accessible under ```Submodules/ThirdPartyBinaries/node``` which will have subfolders for platform bins and a ```node_modules``` folder for our npm module dependencies.

It is possible that it would be good to rename the CEF submodule to ThirdPartyBinaries and include node there to minimize the number of submodules...

http://duktape.org/download.html

data.title: [Script] Add support for missing keys
data.body:
There are some keys that are not supported in Atomic.  So far I know of `comma`, `period`, and `slash`.
They are all supported in SDL, but Urho (and thus Atomic) never explicitly support them.

I have the necessary changes in a branch, but am going to go through and find all of the other missing keys before submitting.

data.title: [Wiki] Instructions for contributing to the wiki
data.body:
We need an article describing how to contribute to the wiki, if anyone should feel like it.

It definitely needs to contain:
- adding links
- adding images
- basic markdown formatting
- (header instructions?)

data.title: [UI] Add new Object Metrics mode to UI::CycleDebugHudMode

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
UI::CycleDebugHudMode was [added here](https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/pull/1334) to cycle between debug hud modes.  When object metrics profiling is enabled, we should add the Object Metrics mode to the cycle.  

The profiler mode can be toggled between performance and object metrics.  So, when cycling set the toggle for object metrics off, and then when cycling from the profiler check whether in performance mode, and if so, go to object metrics instead of wrapping to none

![objecttracking](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/376203/21770609/d23c746c-d638-11e6-8273-be00c6dc1097.jpg)

data.title: Expose CycleDebugHudMode in UI
data.body: This is just a quick add. I'm cycling these modes in our app, and it seemed like a generally useful one to push upstream.

data.title: [Script] Expose Octree container queries to JS/C#/TS
data.body:
We need to be able to retrieve sphere/box container queries from octree drawables in script, this is related to #1314 

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/498e42fcc2ec8f6dbc1a3a78ea0345c1d3931b0d/Source/Atomic/Graphics/OctreeQuery.h

data.title: [TypeScript] Instantiate component to retrieve Inspector Settings
data.body:
Currently the editor inspector retrieves the inspector settings from a component by doing a simple parse of the source code, looking for the inspector settings block.  Ideally, this should be replaced with having the inspector actually instantiate the object and then use the ```object.inspectorSettings``` value.

This would be more robust in that the field will always be available no matter how it's constructed (or transpiled to). 

There are a couple of gotchas to this method though
1) Components would need to be instantiated when inspected (but this may already be happening anyway)
2) the vanilla js way of defining inspector fields would need to change to expose the inspector fields somehow (since the js way doesn't define components as classes like ES6 and TS)

data.title: [Wiki] - Improve C++ IDE and development/redistributable build information

data.title: [Scene Editor] Navigation cube and view text indicator
data.body: To make navegation simple, a 3d view cube like maya could help http://m5designstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/cube.png, and a text indicator like blender does, to indicate in what rotation or prespective we are, https://wiki.blender.org/uploads/thumb/f/fc/Ui_3dview_toolbar-tabs.png/300px-Ui_3dview_toolbar-tabs.png. Also i don't like we you press the number key to change the view, because i need to select one object and it change to orthographic view, I am used to using blender and it is useful to be able to change to any position without losing the prespective

data.title: Toggle to Play camera
data.body: press C key to change between the __atomic_sceneview3d_camera and scene camera. Select a camera and press C to chage to that camera, if you dont select a camere, we change to the first camera compoment in the scene, if there is no camera switch to default (__atomic_sceneview3d_camera), lock the camera pos, rot with L key. Every time it is passed to a user's camera, it is blocked
